snippet: The preserved brain of an American Indian known as ''the last wild man in America'' has been found in a Smithsonian Institution warehouse more than eight decades after it vanished.    Methodical sleuthing by a pair of academics led to a discovery ...
lead_paragraph: The preserved brain of an American Indian known as ''the last wild man in America'' has been found in a Smithsonian Institution warehouse more than eight decades after it vanished. Methodical sleuthing by a pair of academics led to a discovery that may finally permit a proper burial of the last survivor of the Yahi tribe. He was called Ishi, the Yahi word for man, because he never revealed his tribal name.
abstract: University of California at San Francisco reports researchers have found preserved brain of last surviving Yahi tribe member, who lived last five years of his life at school's museum and died in 1916, in Smithsonian Institution warehouse; Smithsonian says it discusses returning brain to Indians in California for burial (M)

headline.main: Brain of Last Yahi Indian Found at Smithsonian
